revised_title: Occlusion of Oxygen and Hydrogen by Platinum Black: Part I
tldr: The authors investigate the occlusion of oxygen and hydrogen by platinum black and find that it retains 0.5% of water, which can only be removed at high temperatures. They determine that platinum black contains about 110 volumes of hydrogen, with 200 volumes converted into water. The authors also observe differences in behavior when heating platinum black charged with oxygen or hydrogen.
